questions_and_notes: Why is this variable "where land" unlike all the other similar variables.  I would think that deposition would be restricted to a transfer to the surface from the air immediately above it.  If so, why not define standard names of the form "surface_mass_flux_of_<species>_due_to_depostion", which I think would be easier to interpret by most users?
cell_methods: area: mean where land time: mean
long_name: Dry and Wet Deposition of Reactive Nitrogen onto Land
